intro: Strophacanthus, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical Africa. These plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors. The leaves are typically thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Strophacanthus species are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their aesthetic appeal and ease of care. They prefer bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
